2009;114:792-801.

trasound diagnostic performance for focal liver lesions using deep
learning: a multicentre study. EBioMedicine 2020;56:102777.

[14] Guo L-H, Wang D, Qian Y-Y, Zheng X, Zhao C-K, Li X-L, et al. A two-stage

[15] Ta CN, Kono Y, Eghtedari M, Oh YT, Robbin ML, Barr RG, et al. Focal liver
lesions: computer-aided diagnosis by using contrast-enhanced US cine

[16] Preis O, Blake MA, Scott JA. Neural network evaluation of PET scans of the

[17] Mokrane F-Z, Lu L, Vavasseur A, Otal P, Peron J-M, Luk L, et al. Radiomics

[18] Yasaka K, Akai H, Abe O, Kiryu S. Deep learning with convolutional neural

[19] Shi W, Kuang S, Cao S, Hu B, Xie S, Chen S, et al. Deep learning assisted

[20] Christ P, Ettlinger F, Griin F, Lipkova J, Kaissis G. Lits - liver tumor seg-
mentation challenge n.d. http://www.lits-challenge.ccom (accessed
December 12, 2021).

[21] Chlebus G, Schenk A, Moltz JH, van Ginneken B, Hahn HK, Meine H.
Automatic liver tumor segmentation in CT with fully convolutional neural

[22] Jansen MJA, Kuijf HJ, Veldhuis WB, Wessels FJ, Viergever MA, Pluim JPW.
Automatic classification of focal liver lesions based on MRI and risk fac-
tors. PLoS One 2019;14:e0217053.

[23] Hamm CA, Wang CJ, Savic LJ, Ferrante M, Schobert I, Schlachter T, et al.
Deep learning for liver tumor diagnosis part I: development of a con-

[24] Zhang F, Yang J, Nezami N, Laage-Gaupp F, Chapiro J, De Lin M, et al. Liver
tissue classification using an auto-context-based deep neural network

[25] Zhen S-H, Cheng M, Tao Y-B, Wang Y-F, Juengpanich §, Jiang Z-Y, et al.
Deep learning for accurate diagnosis of liver tumor based on magnetic
resonance imaging and clinical data. Front Oncol 2020;10:680.

[26] Wang CJ, Hamm CA, Savic LJ, Ferrante M, Schobert I, Schlachter T, et al.
Deep learning for liver tumor diagnosis part II: convolutional neural
network interpretation using radiologic imaging features. Eur Radiol
2019;29:3348-3357.

[27] Liao H, Long Y, Han R, Wang W, Xu L, Liao M, et al. Deep learning-based
classification and mutation prediction from histopathological images of
hepatocellular carcinoma. Clin Trans! Med 2020;10:e102.

[28] Kiani A, Uyumazturk B, Rajpurkar P, Wang A, Gao R, Jones E, et al. Impact

0232-8.

[29] Calderaro J, Couchy G, Imbeaud S, Amaddeo G, Letouzé E, Blanc J-F, et al.
Histological subtypes of hepatocellular carcinoma are related to gene mu-
tations and molecular tumour classification. J Hepatol 2017;67:727-738.

[30] Calderaro J, Ziol M, Paradis V, Zucman-Rossi J. Molecular and histological

[31] Ziol M, Poté N, Amaddeo G, Laurent A, Nault J-C, Oberti F, et al. Macro-
trabecular-massive hepatocellular carcinoma: a distinctive histological
subtype with clinical relevance. Hepatology 2018;68:103-112.

[32] Wang H, Jiang Y, Li B, Cui Y, Li D, Li R. Single-cell spatial analysis of tumor
and immune microenvironment on whole-slide image reveals hepato-
cellular carcinoma subtypes. Cancers (Basel) 2020;12:3562.

[33] Chen M, Zhang B, Topatana W, Cao J, Zhu H, Juengpanich §, et al. Classi-
fication and mutation prediction based on histopathology H&E images in
liver cancer using deep learning. NPJ Precis Oncol 2020;4:14.

[34] Kather JN, Pearson AT, Halama N, Jager D, Krause J, Loosen SH, et al. Deep
learning can predict microsatellite instability directly from histology in
gastrointestinal cancer. Nat Med 2019;25:1054-1056.

[35] Kather JN, Heij LR, Grabsch HI, Loeffler C, Echle A, Muti HS, et al. Pan-
cancer image-based detection of clinically actionable genetic alterations.
Nat Cancer 2020;1:789-799. https://doi.org/10.1038/s43018-020-0087-6.

[36] Fu Y, Jung AW, Torne RV, Gonzalez S, Vohringer H, Shmatko A, et al. Pan-
cancer computational histopathology reveals mutations, tumor compo-
sition and prognosis. Nat Cancer 2020;1:800-810.

[37] Sangro B, Melero I, Wadhawan §, Finn RS, Abou-Alfa GK, Cheng A-L, et al.
Association of inflammatory biomarkers with clinical outcomes in
nivolumab-treated patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma.
J Hepatol 2020;73:1460-1469.

[38] Haber PK, Torres-Martin M, Dufour J-F, Verslype C, Marquardt J, Galle PR,
et al. Molecular markers of response to anti-PD1 therapy in advanced
hepatocellular carcinoma. J Clin Oncol 2021;39. 4100-4100.

[39] Johannet P, Coudray N, Donnelly DM, Jour G, Illa-Bochaca I, Xia Y, et al.
Using machine learning algorithms to predict immunotherapy response
in patients with advanced melanoma. Clin Cancer Res 2021;27:131-140.

[40] Patel SK, George B, Rai V. Artificial intelligence to decode cancer mecha-
nism: beyond patient stratification for precision oncology. Front Phar-
macol 2020. https://doi.org/10.3389/fphar.2020.01177. 0.

[41] Liu S, Yang Z, Li G, Li C, Luo Y, Gong Q, et al. Multi-omics analysis of pri-
mary cell culture models reveals genetic and epigenetic basis of intra-
tumoral phenotypic diversity. Genomics Proteomics Bioinformatics
2019;17:576-589.

[42] Zeng WZD, Glicksberg BS, Li Y, Chen B. Selecting precise reference normal
tissue samples for cancer research using a deep learning approach. BMC
Med Genomics 2019;12:21.

[43] Chaudhary K, Poirion OB, Lu L, Garmire LX. Deep learning-based multi-
omics integration robustly predicts survival in liver cancer. Clin Cancer
Res 2018;24:1248-1259.

[44] Chaudhary K, Poirion OB, Lu L, Huang S, Ching T, Garmire LX. Multimodal
meta-analysis of 1,494 hepatocellular carcinoma samples reveals signifi-
cant impact of consensus driver genes on phenotypes. Clin Cancer Res
2019;25:463-472.

[45] Hwang B, Lee JH, Bang D. Single-cell RNA sequencing technologies and
bioinformatics pipelines. Exp Mol Med 2018;50:1-14.

[46] Xiong X, Kuang H, Ansari S, Liu T, Gong J, Wang S, et al. Landscape of
intercellular crosstalk in healthy and NASH liver revealed by single-cell
secretome gene analysis. Mol Cell 2019;75:644-660.e5.

[47] Ramachandran P, Dobie R, Wilson-Kanamori JR, Dora EF, Henderson BEP,
Luu NT, et al. Resolving the fibrotic niche of human liver cirrhosis at
single-cell level. Nature 2019;575:512-518.

[48] Aizarani N, Saviano A, Sagar, Mailly L, Durand S, Herman Js, et al. A human
liver cell atlas reveals heterogeneity and epithelial progenitors. Nature
2019;572:199-204.

[49] Zheng C, Zheng L, Yoo J-K, Guo H, Zhang Y, Guo X, et al. Landscape of
infiltrating T cells in liver cancer revealed by single-cell sequencing. Cell
2017;169:1342-1356.e16.

[50] Zhang Q, He Y, Luo N, Patel SJ, Han Y, Gao R, et al. Landscape and dynamics of
single immune cells in hepatocellular carcinoma. Cell 2019; 179:829-845.e20.

[51] Kim JK, Kolodziejczyk AA, Ilicic T, Teichmann SA, Marioni JC. Character-
izing noise structure in single-cell RNA-seq distinguishes genuine from
technical stochastic allelic expression. Nat Commun 2015;6:8687.

[52] Jia C, Hu Y, Kelly D, Kim J, Li M, Zhang NR. Accounting for technical noise
in differential expression analysis of single-cell RNA sequencing data.
Nucleic Acids Res 2017;45:10978-10988.

[53] Papalexi E, Satija R. Single-cell RNA sequencing to explore immune cell
heterogeneity. Nat Rev Immunol 2018;18:35-45.

[54] Kharchenko PV, Silberstein L, Scadden DT. Bayesian approach to single-
cell differential expression analysis. Nat Methods 2014;11:740-742.

[55] Arisdakessian C, Poirion O, Yunits B, Zhu X, Garmire LX. DeepImpute: an
accurate, fast, and scalable deep neural network method to impute single-
cell RNA-seq data. Genome Biol 2019;20:211.

[56] Amodio M, van Dijk D, Srinivasan K, Chen WS, Mohsen H, Moon KR, et al.
Exploring single-cell data with deep multitasking neural networks. Nat
Methods 2019;16:1139-1145.
